title: Conversation Practice
goal: Describe people and things using relative clauses.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Relative clause review:

poi = ? (function)
noi = ? (function)
pe = ? (function)

(Answers: restrictive (identifies), incidental (adds info), short association)

New Material (5-7 min)

Describing People

lo prenu poi melbi je clani cu tavla mi

The person who is beautiful and tall talks to me.

la .alis. noi mi pendo cu finti lo pemci

Alice, who is my friend, creates poems.

Describing Things

lo cukta poi mi tcidu ke'a ca lo nicte cu lisri

The book which I read at night is a story.

lo zgike pe la .bob. cu melbi

Bob's music is beautiful.

Sample Dialogue

A: do viska ma
B: mi viska lo gerku poi blanu
A: xu ri barda
B: na go'i .i ri cmalu je melbi
A: .ui mi nelci lo gerku poi cmalu

(A: What do you see? B: I see a dog which is blue. A: Is it big? B: No. It's small and beautiful. A: Happy! I like dogs which are small.)

Key Point

Use relative clauses naturally to specify and describe in conversation.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Describe People

Translate:

  1. The person who sings is my friend.
  2. Bob, who is tall, works.
  3. I love the person who is beautiful.
Answers
  1. lo prenu poi sanga cu mi pendo
  2. la .bob. noi clani cu gunka
  3. mi prami lo prenu poi melbi

Exercise 2: Describe Things

Translate:

  1. The book which is red is good.
  2. My house is big.
  3. I see the picture which Alice created.
Answers
  1. lo cukta poi xunre cu xamgu
  2. lo zdani pe mi cu barda
  3. mi viska lo pixra poi la .alis. cu finti

Exercise 3: Dialogue

Create responses:

  1. Q: "What do you see?" — A: "I see a cat which is small."
  2. Q: "Who is that?" — A: "That is Bob, who is my friend."
Answers
  1. mi viska lo mlatu poi cmalu
  2. ta la .bob. noi mi pendo

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say this dialogue aloud:

A: ti mo
B: ti cukta poi mi tcidu ke'a
A: xu ri xamgu
B: .ie ri lisri poi melbi
A: .ui mi djica lo nu tcidu ke'a

(A: What is this? B: This is a book which I read. A: Is it good? B: Yes, it's a story which is beautiful. A: Happy! I want to read it.)

Today's Practice

Conversation patterns:

Pattern Meaning
lo X poi... The X which...
la NAME noi... NAME, who...
lo X pe mi My X

Summary

You practiced using relative clauses in natural conversation to describe people and things.
